Art. 4.257. 
Rights of the spouse of the settlor 
The spouse of the settlor may intervene in the agreement referred to in Article 4.254 in order to consent thereto.   
Unless otherwise provided for in the agreement, the consent of the spouse entails his or her waiver of the action for reduction of the gifts referred to in the agreement. This is stated in the agreement.
The agreement remains without effect with regard to the surviving spouse who, having the status of spouse at the time of the signing of the agreement, did not intervene to consent to it.
With regard to the surviving spouse referred to in paragraph 1, the gifts referred to in the agreement are, for the purposes of reduction and report, presumed to have been granted jointly to all the presumptive heirs in the direct descending line who are parties to the agreement.
 A surviving spouse who has acquired this status subsequent to the signature of the agreement may not request the reduction of the gifts included in the agreement.
